page.title: 18HOME FARM.
page.content: Home Farm dates back to about 1886. There are 175 acres. The crops they grow are wheat, barley, oats and rape. The farm has 2 combine harvesters, 2 tractors, a plough and a land rover. The farm is near Aycliffe, Darlington, Bishop Auckland and Durham, so they can sell their crops easily. There are a few farm buildings including farm houses. There is a pond where a moorhen nests every year. There are chickens and sheep. The farm is surrounded by trees. When I went, I saw a swallow's nest and a few starlings' nests. They had a ginger cat and a black and white one.Some chickens wandered about the farmyard, with 5 cockerels amongst them. The barn was full of straw. On the O.S. map of 1953 the farm was called Park Farm, but now it is named Home Farm.
